description: Friendly staff, clean coffeehouse and knowledgeable/accommodating for dairy allergy! Had a regular coffee with coconut milk and added coconut whipped cream. Plenty of seating indoors including a street view for people watching if that's your thing. Priced well, won't break the bank!
author: April O.

description: Disappointed to experience a crowded unsanitary environment. Food all over the floor, guys behind counter fiddling w the trash and then making coffee. Bathrooms filthy. Remodel needed.
author: T W.

description: How hard is it to order coffee beans ground for auto drip? Woman at counter completely inept, didn't know what the hell I was talking about, gave me espresso grind. I know this sounds like a first world problem and maybe not a big deal. It is just incredibly annoying. Why is it I can do this at Trader Joe's myself without any "professional training"? Too late to take back as I live in east bay. Won't return to this location.
author: Alison M.

description: Great coffee and service at a busy location, just the rainy day pickup I was looking for!! Heaven meet peets :)
author: Coco J.

description:
In a big city sometimes one can feel lost or alone; even when there are thousands of people standing around you. That's why I love Peets & the community that Peets creates.
The baristas are friendly & knowledgeable. They're willing to share their knowledge & not just push product to you.
I really think that's awesome.
In retail, a business is usually focused on $. Here at Peets, they are also interested in people: their customers & their staff. 

You see families congregate here. You see parents with their kids or dogs or both.

On this day before Christmas, reflect on your blessings...for me I'm thankful that Peets is here and it's part of the San Francisco Bay Area community.
Merry Christmas to all & Happy Holidays!
author: Joanna T.

description:
Don't just fucking slosh warm milk into espresso and call it a cappuccino. Might as well go to Starbucks if that's the shit you serve. 

Peets is so much better than Starbucks, but this place has really fallen in the last 6 months. Lots of employee turnover and no attention to what they are doing. And super slow.
author: Tim S.

description:
Great Peet's at this neighborhood and doing some important stuff on a Monday.
A great place to watch people walking in Fillmore.
Training a cashier and a new barista in the morning. Great customer service skills and friendly too.
author: Jade M.

description:
Since I was making daily visits to the CPMC, I would walk down two block to get my cup of Peet's.  Located at the corner of Fillmore and Sacramento, this is actually one of the larger Peet's that I've been to.  

Service is fast and friendly.  Though I've been taking my cup of Joe to go, I could easily park myself to the one of the many table and seats in the front of the store. Being a corner location, it offers a great "people watching" view of the street unless you're on Wi-Fi, as I could see people on their smartphones and laptops. 

A great Peet's for the Fillmore area.
author: Al L.

description: This Peet's rocks! They have a ton of VEGAN COOKIES! They are only $2 too, so so cheap! Highly recommend getting one, and having a nice iced coffee with their maple syrup. mmmmmmm so tasty. Seating is limited, but if you can find space then it is a great way to spend the afternoon reading or getting some work done.
author: Emily H.

description:
This is my closest Peet's so I visit about once a week. It's usually filled with regulars reading and people-watching. The line is never too bad and the drinks are always prepared with care. 

But today they really earned my loyalty with their customer service. I accidentally spilled the cappuccino they'd just handed me, and they were extremely gracious with the cleanup, and also replaced my drink for free. I will definitely come back.
author: Claudia G.

description:
Work at CPMC, decided to take a break and reward my work week with a Friday morning treat from my favorite coffee shop, Peet's. I've never been to this specific location, I'm new to the area.

Very busy, but clean.

Ordered medium iced coffee, asked for milk to be added to coffee. Cashier pointed behind me and said I could fill it up myself at the station for customers. I acknowledged the location, repeated the request for milk to be added to my drink, and she said the exact same thing to me and pointed behind me. 

I smiled, paid (minus my usual tip) and suddenly noticed the cost of the usual medium iced coffee I order from Peet's. For the first time in over 10 years of being a customer did I actually feel upset by the $3+ cost of my drink. Because when you're not receiving customer service you're accustomed to, then you start to analyze the cost benefit much closer. 

I just wanted to get the usual stellar customer service I'm accustomed to when interacting with Peet's staff. I was unfortunately let down and felt worse than when I had entered. I don't feel comfortable returning to a location that doesn't actively listen and respond appropriately to it's customers and also not recognize that we pay the extra money to get coffee out for the convenience and interaction (we are provided free coffee at work, I don't need to go to Peet's, I chose to).
author: Brandie O.

description:
Decent Peets, are rare fine where the line moves almost as fast  as  Starbucks

This Peets even still serves Gunpowder Tea, one that made Peets famous.... but many of the franchise stores refuse to carry (not enough margin)

Bad part, a half measure attempt to serve the thousands of glutenfree  customers

Starbucks has pulled their delicious lemon cake years ago, so even seeing wheat free at Peets is nice... but stacked on top of wheat products renders this attempt  fruitless
author: Alan R.

description:
- fairly consistent quality in terms of drinks
- lots of small tables, counter and stool spaces, a few outlets
- popular neighborhood spot tends to be pretty packed, which is what drags the wifi speed down
- single restroom, spacious enough for stroller, has a baby changing station, surprisingly clean considering the constant flow of traffic, can be rather smelly
author: LBear B.

description: I started coming to this Peet's location alittle over 3 months and the service here is amazing! Staff is great they treat you like family always smiling just a great atmosphere. Frank, Eric, Joshua, Diego, Micheal etc... all amazing individuals. Great place to come have a dark roast coffee and enjoy the ambiance while at it.
author: Ahmad O.

description:
Plenty of seating inside with some power outlets and free wi-fi. There were a ton of people on their laptops in here. Unfortunately Peet's wi-fi was really slow for me this time though. 

This location is well air conditioned on those rare hot days like today in San Francisco. Service is quick and friendly. I got an iced medium latte ($4) and it was really refreshing!
author: Linda X.

description:
They have changed their coffee and it's weak piss water now. 
Like when you put the cream in there, you see it go all the way down like a cup of tea. 
I talked to the morning baristas, they offered to give me a new cup. 
What? No...I don't want another cup of that crap, I want the old strong thick coffee that peets was known for 
I wrote to customer service ...they sent me a card for a free drink 
What???? NO. Just put more ground in the machine so it's not weak as sHit!!! 
Ugh. 
I guess I need to break up with my steady coffee place ... At least philz is still there. Sadly it's far away.
author: Nilu r.

description: Coffee is great / big fan. When it's sunny dayStaff are friendly. Tip them if you can.
author: PerK N.

description: Had a single shot cappuccino. The service was friendly, amazing interior design. Coffee was ok... the cappuccino was crafted beautifully but the coffee itself was too bitter. Would definitely choose this coffee shop over its more popular competitor.
author: Maryna C.

description:
I normally don't post reviews like this, but I absolutely love Peet's and my experience here was pretty sad.

I went in around April 21 (I don't remember the exact date now) only to be snapped at by a man with a bunch of flowers on his apron. The irony.

I accidentally referred to the drink size I was ordering as "grande" as opposed to Peet's chosen language of "medium." I get it, there's some sort of weird competition between Peet's and Starbucks. But I really don't think I deserved the, "You mean MEDIUM? You should go up the street if you want a 'grande,'" I got in return.

It wasn't even as if he was trying to clarify my order. He understood just fine. He was pretty clearly just trying to shame me, which is perhaps more sad than irritating.

Regardless, it just kind of ruined the latte and cookie-purchasing experience that I had there. To top it off, my drink was made hot instead of iced, so I had to stand there (next to this barista who was dripping with resentment for me because I inadvertently used Italian instead of English to describe a DRINK SIZE, mind you) while they re-made it correctly.

Moral of the story, not all flower children are citizens of the world?

Ciao!
author: Cecily T.

description:
Great location and Great service.

Just bought a french press and the guy who helped me was awesome. He recommended an amazing Uzuri african blend.... It actually tastes like it was brewed at Peet's. Sooo Happy.

Thank you for your help...you guys rock.
author: David G.

description:
Thank you Yelp for the check in offer to try out Peet's new coconut black tie! I walked into this Peet's thinking I was gonna be boring and just get an iced coffee but the coupon got me to try something new and exciting! If you don't like coconut, don't get this haha! This drink is sweet, creamy, and SOOO coconutty! It just takes you to paradise with one sip! Mm! 

The cashier was new but very nice. I got my drink super fast! So no complaints there! I had a great experience today! Keep up the good work, Peet's Fillmore!
author: Taylor W.

description:
Peet's is such a great brand. I mean, they are superior to that Evil Mermaid in just about every category. 

I've never been to this location and will likely never be back. I absolutely needed coffee and everywhere we looked, S Bucks. Pulled up Yelp, searched for Peet's and found exactly what we were searching for. Piping hot, strong, delicious coffee.
author: Hector G.

description: Used the Yelp deal and grabbed a caramel latte for $2.75. AWESOME!! Peets is strong bold coffee so I appreciate the caffeine level in all their roasts. This location has a lot of seating so it could be a spot to do work or study. Most important (sadly so with all chain coffee spots) I have to emphasize that this one is clean and the staff are friendly!
author: Manisha S.

description:
WORST WIFI in the entire city of SF...you could just wait, and wait, and wait...for that hourglass that shows the connection is being attempted...you could finish your entire cup of coffee, and that friggin hourglass will still be there...OMG, so frustrating !!!

Peet's !!! Our telling you repeatedly that your WIFI sucks does not seem to have made a difference...so I finally thought I would give you a 1-star review for the crappy WIFI...I am sure Peet's can afford to get a better WIFI connection...I don't think it will cost much, but the desire to give better service to your customers has to be there...if Peet's improves the WIFI connection, I will improve and change my review rating...so Peet's ! the ball is now in your Court...show your Customers that you care...
author: Raj D.

description:
Who would have thought I'd cheat on Philz but when I learned that Peetz actually offers French Press coffee, I got intrigued. And this is how the story ends, in an unnoticed moment (Philz was busy with other men, I guess) I sneaked out and into Peetz, curiously wandering around the store, exploring the extensive coffee menu. French Press to-go? Sounded perfect for me, especially since Philz usually notices if I'm away for too long.

Requested my French Press to be made with Ethiopian beans, paid about $3.25, added some Half-n-Half to it, and ready was the most delicious coffee experience since I left the house this morning. Bye Peetz, gotta run, back I'll be back soon. And don't tell Philz.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Java java java.

Standard Peet's, and unusually poppin' for a Sunday afternoon, but alas, no simple syrup for my iced Americano, which is the main reason I go to Peet's. So I had grains of sugar in my drink, first world problems. I also got half caf, half decaf since it was rounding 5PM and I didn't want to be up all night, and it tasted kind of funny. Oh well, another day another grainy, odd tasting Americano.
author: Crystal C.

description: Best coffee in the world in my opinion! As well this is my favorite Peet's in San Francisco. I really like the people inside and outside. It's a great place to set outside, enjoying a cup of coffee as I watch people go by. Thanks for being a great coffee shop Peet's on Fillmore! UPDATE: Ignore my previous review above, other than great coffee and good people inside. There are two things here that I find very annoying 1. Is that Peet's is allowing the pan handler to park his ass right in front of there establishment. He's right in front of you as you try to have a enjoyable cup of coffee on the bench out front. He bothers every single passerby, and comments on personal conversations, Peet's allows it.. 2. Peet's allows smokers to continue smoking at the side tables, right by non smoking signs. Getting really hard to have that 'having a nice cup feeling' that I used to have there. Nauseating cigarette smoke, and some bum that never stops asking for handouts. Get some balls and clean the place up! Then I will replace my five stars.
author: Kirk M.

description:
The staff seemed great, but the wifi is awful. The only place it actually works is standing next to the espresso machine. In 2016, adequate wifi is a prerequisite for any chain coffee shop to get a rating reflective of the staff or other factors.

It should be a quick fix!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Any place that carries rare, hard-to-find beans surely deserves a visit.  Unaware of the fact that the Jamaican Blue Mountain roast was a goner, I opted for the substitution on the menu.  The barista delivered the news and I could not be happier with the understudy for the JBM.  It was....A PANAMANIAN beauty.  I ordered a large.

My wife's cold coffee was one of the best I've ever tasted.  It was nearly a mini-milkshake with creamy, almost sweet flavors even in the absence of sweeteners.  My hot coffee was one of the best I've tasted.  It was nearly Panamanian Emerald (most of which goes to Japan....we get the scraps when there are any leftovers).

Wow...what a place.  I can't say enough good things about the selection here.  I would love to have one near home.
author: John L.

description: I love the latest flavor of Havana Latte with cinnamon. Simply delicious for both morning caffeine and afternoon recharge.
author: Nessa M.

description:
Peet's is not just a Fillmore St. coffee shop. It's the social hub of the neighborhood.
This place is always hoppin'. The coffee's always brewing; the lines are long; and all their outdoor tables are full with regulars.

It's understandable because they serve a good product. Unlike other coffee chains (ahem, Starbucks), Peet's brews some damn fine coffee. And make no mistake, this coffee is STRONG (like Red Bull strong). So consider yourself warned.

Peet's also offers a selection of teas, sweets, and other goodies. I would come here more often, but the place is just too damn crowded. That's obviously no fault of Peet's. They're just a victim of their own success.

For the record, Peet's is an excellent member of the community. They've donated coffee to my niece and nephew's school on numerous occasions.
author: Kevin B.

description:
This Peet's is always busy but it is right near my house so I am a frequent visitor. Great coffee and nice staff! 

The one bone I have to pick with them: hands down worst Internet I have ever encountered in a coffee shop. Quite unbelievable. I thought it was my laptop but I have pulled out my Hotspot multiple times and it is about 20x faster than theirs. Not sure what the deal is
author: Stephen -.

description:
Seriously, please get some decently fast wifi. I realize it's free but when you are getting less than half a MBPS you might as well not have it at all. At least half the people coming in come for the wifi. It would be a good investment and would keep people like me coming back. 

I really love peets. Given the choice between starbucks and peets its peets every time, but I need some megabits over here please.
author: Seth L.

description: Corner store coffee shop. The barista's know you by name and the coffee is always heavenly. I've been going to this place for years and have frequently come across the same sweet faces. I absolutely adore this place; Peet's can do no wrong.
author: Caye Q.

description:
I absolutely love Peet's so much better than Starbucks !!

This location is awesome as its close to my work ... Downside is there's really no parking & they have an extremely small waiting area 

The baristas can be hit or miss but Will is by far their best barista !!!
author: Jessica B.

description: This was my favorite Peete's that I have been in. Great decor and quick and friendly service. I loved the bar seating along the windows and the coffees were great!
author: Samantha H.

description: Service from two baristas was friendly, and my darjeeling tea was delicious. The ginger spice cookies are really good here.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Ok just had the drip and it was terrible, however the energy and bustling was enough to draw me in. Unfortunate I ordered the wrong drink. And no Stevia sweetener :-(

Not too keen to go back, maybe one more try and I'll order something else.
author: Denni P.

description: My local Peets coffee in Millbrae. The line is never too long and the quality is consistent on a day to day basis. Great air conditioning when days are warm. Batistas are nice. Place is a bit small though and if you're trying to find a quiet place to work look elsewhere. Free wifi.
author: Doug R.

description: I love peets coffee but the staff who served me on the cashier is kinda rude...to be exact the one w shaved colored hair...it wouldn't hurt to say hi first while I'm choosing the drink I want than asking me straight if my dogs are service dogs...a smile could've help..
author: Cj C.

description: Ordered an iced vanilla latte around 3pm today and it was horrible! Took maybe two sips before I threw it out. It was bitter and just nasty! Even a friend of mine who is not picky with coffee took one sip of her iced latte and said it was the worse tasting coffee she ever had. The coffee beans were probably burned from the morning batch and used for the afternoon iced drinks....blehhhhhh!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great interior, but bad wifi. It took 3 minutes to download a 3 page .docx from my email :-(
author: Elliott D.

description: I came here primarily to check some e-mail after my business at the nearby German Embassy.  Coffee is great but there was trash on several tables left by previous customers and the WiFi was unusable because of it's slow speed.  Not sure if they are slow because of a low cost connection or if the neighbors are just stealing the bandwith but the speed didn't seem to improve even as many patrons left.  Measured DL speed was 0.20 Mbps and upload speed was 0.00 Mbps.
author: Mark G.

description: I love this Peets!  This place is always packed with locals.  I go every morning and they have never messed up my large iced whole milk caramel latte.  Mmmmmm.  Go and try one.  Seriously.
author: Paul W.

description: Good spot, except for the mess outside on Sacramento Street.  Garbage cans are disgusting and are left out 24/7 and have been forever.  looks like a back alley in the Tenderloin.  Lots of litter most of the time, rarely seems to be cleaned up.  Unfortunate for the neighborhood,
author: Glenn S.

description: A great selection of teas with seasonal mixes like Winter Solstice. And they serve coffee too. The beans here aren't over cooked and care is taken to provide a quality product.
author: SF P.

description: My friend came to this locations booth for the Filmore Jazz festival. There were three people clumped together, not in a line format, so she thought they were already done and just chillin'. She went to grab a sample cup of their new drink, and the two workers there reallllly rudely said "THERES A LINE". I work in customer service, I get it, but honestly, say it politely. She didn't know. So she put the cup down some she barely touched it, and again they rudely said "you might as well take it since you already touched it". Okay, way to have terrible customer service. They shouldn't be in a customer service job if they're going to be rude. Honestly, neither of us want to support peets now. We'll take our business and college coffee cravings elsewhere.
author: Shira S.

description:
Not bad. The lighting is a bit dim. It makes me sleepy. The workers here are very attentive and polite. The seating here isn't as comfy as the starbucks across the street. Peet's has a lot of wooden chairs and benches.

Not sure who's wifi I was using but it was definitely not Peet's. They require an access code to prevent people from loitering.
author: Sarah C.

description: Ordered chocolate croissant but given regular croissant. Do I pay less or more? I don't bother to check....
author: Yong D.

description:
Single latte.
Barista got my name wrong 
(this time it was JERRY)
The latte satisfied.
Although I facepalmed the door upon exiting
(courtesy of hot blonde babe with the knee-high leather boots).
author: Derek N.

description: Peets for me 100% .. their coffee is never bitter and service has always been great.
author: Annette G.

description:
I love Peet's, but lately their Aged Sumatra tastes like regular Sumatra, and is very oily, which has not been my past experience. I still go and hope that which ever roaster they lost returns and their coffee becomes incredible again.

This particular Peet's on Fillmore St. is the most disappointing, mainly because of their customer service, or lack of customer service.

They ran out of Sea Salt and could not make any drinks that required that, and they ran out of their Blue Mountain Coffee, though they left the sign in front of their register up advertising availability. And the quad mocha I ordered was weak.

This makes that particular corner the worst Peet's in San Francisco.

I wish them Happy Holidays and a visit from the Peet's Quality Fairy in the next quarter.
author: Dean N.

description: Nice folks. They pay attention to detail but are very quick. I definitely prefer this location.
author: Theresa S.

description: My go-to for a cup of black coffee. Staff is always friendly, coffee is always fresh. That's basically what's required of a coffee shop and Peet's has it!
author: Sarah V.

description: Standard Peet's coffee shop! Seating is usually limited because lots of people take advantage of the free wifi here. When you walk in, you'll notice that there is a weird smell, perhaps from the new flooring they installed recently.
author: Victoria G.

description:
After my appointment, window shopping, real shopping , etc., I was in dire need of caffeine. I ordered my staple: medium-wet cap. Well, my drink was not wet enough nor was the foam good. To top it off, this was probably one of the dirtiest Peet's I have ever been to. 

When in the area again, I might venture elsewhere and that makes me sad...
author: Tam F.

description: Went in and ordered 2 café lattes. They were not made as well as other Peets, just ok. However, the African American girl making the drink was very rude. She grimaced when approached as she called out 2 lattes, but no name. She snapped back what name? She behaved like customers were a bother. The older male cashier, however was friendly and polite. There was no design whatsoever on the foam and just looked like it was thrown together. Also, always a line for the restroom, as there is only 1 for men and women. Overall, not worth the trip in. Disappointed
author: Jason M.

description:
transplant to California who found happiness in Peet's Coffee & Tea. This location is always busy but fast with great service.
If you like your chooses of drink condiments, this place has it covered!!!!!
author: Quinn S.

description:
I only came here after settling because Coffee Bean closed across the street. The coffee is alright, though not Coffee Bean caliber. However, Peets loses major points for customer service for me. I'm confused by all the reviews saying that the people are polite, maybe I'm going at the wrong time. I have been here three times and each staff member acts as though Jesus himself is serving the coffee. It's ridiculous. Eye rolling, sighs, sneers (basically over asking for a iced mocha, so really? Not asking for the world)...I'm a pretty easygoing person, generally don't expect the world of people, but I always leave feeling horrible. Never again Peets. There are other coffee shops in this area and I can find one sans the attitude. 

However, as a caveat, this applies to the two men who work around the 3-4 p.m. time. Not sure what the staff is like any other time. I hear the morning is generally good. The afternoon staff is rude enough to make me never return though. 

Plus one star for the guy who actually MAKES the coffee...because he always fills my cup to the top, with limited ice, which is awesome. Makes it worth the $$ I pay and he's always very friendly.
author: K S.

description: Lazy staff and the bathroom shows it. Posted picture. Yuk!
author: Daria M.

description:
Scuzzy inside.  Crowded.  No room to spread out.  No character. Very nice staff.  Peet's coffee is good.  There is no arguing that.  Peanut butter cookie was nada special.

Yesterday while trying to study I was forced to listen to the conversation of the two middle-aged guys next to me.  Guy #1 thinks it's okay to date 18 year old women but guy #2 thinks that's too young.  Tables are so close together and clientele so questionable you don't have the option to tune this stuff out.
author: Meg M.

description: The crew working was fast and friendly. The sitting area was packed on a rainy day but the out side area if the wind is blowing right will keep you dry.
author: Sean G.

description: My old neighborhood! Every time I visit the city. I always stop at this location. For my hazelnut americano or cafe mocha. Its on the spot. Also the people here are as warm as the drinks. I love love love just sitting outside on a Sunday watching people walk their dogs and just be.
author: Carol L.

description:
Simply said, my favorite neighborhood coffee shop.  

Strong, delicious coffee!  The folks who work here are always professional and kind.
author: Ronnie T.

description: The lines are soooo long here. All Pete's are the same, the only difference is who can get your coffee to you faster, and this is not the place to go for that.
author: Tim L.

description: Espresso made the right way. Excellent quality and very friendly staff. Great location outside of the business and touristic areas. Nothing against those, I like them too. This is the place where locals go for their coffee.
author: Nando G.

description:
Previously had negative comments because of a burnt latte. 

However, my concern was addressed by the manager and I was pleased to update my negative review. I am amazed. I have never felt so special by a company who have gone above and beyond. Thanks Peet's!

I look forward to trying your latte again and will sure come back to this location!
author: J C.

description: Great service, great coffee. I only wish there were more of these in Denver but a coffee shop I love to visit whenever I see one. The service is extremely helpful and the staff has a great knowledge of coffee and tea.
author: Patrick C.

description: Definitely THE place for coffee when I'm in the neighborhood. So imagine my disappointment and puzzlement when there yesterday, and it was CLOSED, construction happening inside, paper on the windows, and no sign!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Come here with the right locals and it's like an episode of freakin' Cheers. I'm hoping to eventually become Diane, but I have a feeling I'm a little more Carla.

Not only is this one of those places where everybody knows your name, the service is also friendly and efficient (likely due to the staff's investment in the neighborhood regulars' enjoyment of their morning fixes) and there is always plenty of seating, both indoors and out. There are also plenty of babies and dogs running around, which is also cool if you (like me) have neither but find both to be entertaining and adorable.
author: Autumn K.

description: Typical Peet's, but in a great location across the street from the bus stop! My friends and I were shivering and could not bear to wait the 15 minutes before our bus came, so we shuffled into the Peet's to order some hot drinks and take advantage of their heater! I really like how this one has a wide selection of things to add to your coffee - they have simple syrup out along with cinnamon and chocolate powder!
author: Melody L.

description:
In the coffee shop world along fillmore, this peets stands out in one aspect to me:  the lack of self important hipster types hanging out.  it felt like a neighboorhood place.  folks were having conversations, smiling, saying good morning etc etc.  not the case with some of the other places in this hood.  

Normally (and historically), I hit up the Peets on Geary, but we were in pac heights for the weekend.  

The pastries are good, and the baristas were quick.  they could be better organized in terms of the latte pick up area.
author: Pablo E.

description: I feel bad saying this because the staff here are nice. But there's this TERRIBLE group of old guys who meet here every night and talk really loud and they're awful. Tonight they spent 30+ minutes talking loudly in the most explicit and degrading ways about which female politicians they find f**kable, even turning up my headphones all the way wasn't enough to drown out their super gross sexist inappropriate conversation. I tried to find out if there are nights when those guys AREN'T there. The staff said yeah, they suck and they're here every night. I don't know if the staff lacks the power to kick those guys out but maybe if their manager sees this? Every woman in the place moved as far away as they could or did like I did and left. It's not just that they're awful, it's that they're unavoidable. There's nowhere to sit where you can't hear them. I will never ever come back here when these guys are here, which is apparently every night. :-(
author: Diana S.

description:
By far Peet's Coffee is my favorite coffee.  It's strong, and flavorful. It makes every other coffee place taste like they're serving hot water.  

I've yelped at other Peet's, but this one deserves a 5+ stars because the morning staff is amazing. If Milette, Bruce and Brandon are still there, you guys are awesome and made the place feel like "Cheers".   It's where everybody knows your name... drink , and pastry.  The line will be out the door and yet I'll still get my coffee in 5 minutes. The pastry are to die for- especially the scones and cinnamon twist.
author: Thao T.

description: The staff was super helpful with recommending a good drink. Never had Peets and the pumpkin freddo was delicious on a hot sunny day
author: Angela L.

description:
For me, the coffee here gets it done and is perfectly fine, but this review gets 4 stars for 2 reasons: 

Vegan cookie: they have this vegan cookie I think it is like a snicker-doodle or something that is sooo mouth watering! 2 stars for making me realize that vegan food is more than tofu! You have to forgive me, I am from Florida and the Floridian palate is quite unrefined so please feel free to inform me of and escort me to any earth friendly, organic, locally grown, sustainable, raw, vegetarian, vegan, grass fed, free range, cage free restaurants that are tasty and I will be there! 

Anyways, reason number 2 is because I went in one night 2 minutes before closing, but I was desperate for a cold drink. I had just walked a million blocks after having spent the day shopping (more walking) and I just needed some hydration. I walked in and nobody looked at me weird as if I was annoying them. Then, I asked if they had any tea still left for iced tea. The girl informed me that she had just thrown it out. Very politely, she said that she would make some more for me and that it would just take a few minutes to brew. How many people do you know 2 minutes before closing who would offer to dirty more dishes and stay after closing time to make tea?? Sooo nice. 
Of course, I am not a totally jerk, I politely declined (which I am sure they were all grateful for) and bought a bottle of water. I just give them 2 huge stars for being so nice!
author: M M.

description:
Im not exceptionally fastidious but at 6:00 pm, their bathroom was horrendous! The garbage can was stuffed and overflowing. There was toilet paper and such all over the floor, and no toilet paper on the rollers.
The coffee was fine, as always.
author: Da W.

description:
Standard good Pete's products, but good grief! This place needs a makeover and better ventilation (it's stifling in there). Very dilapidated walls (can you say depressing?), beat up furnishings (inside and outside), dirty counters and gross, old newspapers all over. Kind of abusive toward the clientele, actually. They are on a fantastic retail corner which I guess explains the smug neglect of the place bc customers will buy anyway.  However,  it's a real disrespect not only to the consumer but to the overall elegance of Fillmore's retail.

Get with it, for Pete's sake!!!
author: silvia d.

description:
Lack lustre franchise. The management are ridiculous and really undermine the Pete's brand credibility, buckling to any customer with a bad attitude and bit of bass in their tone. Harried, under trained staff being bullied by Pac Heights customers. 

Every time I have been there the experience has been depressing and the drinks mediocre. Its like Tully's or Starbucks without the confidence in their beverage production methods.
author: Blue A.

description:
So I just walked all the way down to Fillmore from Lyon St. for the sole purpose of reviewing this Peet's.

I know this one well, but I don't frequent it much any more, because I have a little problem and I don't know how to fix it.

See, almost two years ago one of my buddies lived in the hood so we'd meet up for coffee a couple of times a week. Since neither of us were working regular jobs our coffee sessions came at odd times. Fortunately for us it meant that Peet's was never crowded (as it was at quarter to 9 this morning,) but unfortunately that makes the experience a bit less anonymous. 

So after four or five visits I noticed a really uncomfortable trend: there was this women, about my age, maybe a few years older who was always there when we were there. She's tan, very fit, always in athletic clothes. I'm not trying to tell you I'm attracted to her, because I'm not, but I'm telling you I couldn't shake this broad.

To this day I haven't exchanged a word with her, but she keeps popping up, not only at Peet's anymore. I see her running, I see her at brunch. And in different neighborhoods, too.

She acts like she's never noticed me, which is ridiculous, but every once in awhile she'll give a look over her shoulder while jogging, and I never have time to throw up my arms to say "It ain't me."

I mean on paper I'm like one of the 6 least threatening guys in San Francisco. I'm short and I'm round and warm and fuzzy and all of a sudden I'm the stalker? F that!

Doesn't this person do her homework? Hasn't she done a composite sketch of me and fed into the new Google Image Identifier and run a full background and credit check on me yet? 

Jeez, I just want an F-ing coffee lady, stop following me!

Anyway, she wasn't there today.
author: Jason R.

description:
Oh the joy of being back in the heartland of Peet's Coffee.  Yes, Boston does have one Peet's, but was located far from where I lived and worked and required a lot of engineering to get there.  I used to save a section of my suitcase just to take 20 pounds of Peet's beans back to Boston when I'd visit my family back home in Oakland.  

Now, I consider this MY Peet's.  The service is incredible -- they are savvy to the personal angst of their customers and speed it up when they sense you're running late, but also are friendly and chat if you have more time.  

My favorites are the Major Dickason's, and the Sumatra.  

I do wish this location would give more attention to the restroom -- it tends to be grimy and in need of deep cleaning as well as ongoing tidying throughout the day.  I know there are a couple of habitual homeless who make this Peet's their HQ, and wonder if they might even be recruited (and paid) to keep an eye on things?
author: Sebastian S.

description: Major disappointment at this location. Horrible smell in cafe so decide to order drink for outside enjoyment. Ordered Large Mocha with Almond milk and made it crystal clear that I wanted mostly foam. Even asked what the proper 'Peet's' name is for this exact order. Watching the Barista making it he used mostly liquid almond milk with very little foam. When I kindly question the opposite of what I order he says 'You ordered this. If you wanted that then here's the proper name for it'. Seriously buddy??? I take 1 sip and realize I do indeed want him to make it again. He has been angry the entire time blaming me. 2nd time around I asked if it said whipped cream on order. He says 'yeh, I saw it but that's an oxymoron and decided you shouldn't have it.' I said when I'm paying $8 I can have it whatever way I like.' I came here for a major treat and to relax. Thanks AH for making my time so special and valuing me as a customer!!!
author: Sandy S.

description:
There's a Peets inside the Kabuki Theater.  

It's at the top of the escalators, on the mezzanine.  It's not in the Peets company directory, but it has a sign outside the building and another one on the store.  

It's operated by the Kabuki Theater.  

Besides the usual coffee, tea, and pastries, it has candy and soft drinks.  There don't appear to be any hot dogs or popcorn, though.  

We purchased two chocolate-dipped coconut macaroons, a hot tea, and a diet Coke for $8.25, and then we retreated to a nearby lounge to enjoy our wait for the movie.
author: David D.

description:
I try really hard not to buy from chains, but I get to work really early (around 7am) most days, which means two things:

1. Most of the other coffee shops I like are barely open at 6:50/7 so that limits my options.
2.  I need something stronger than hell to keep me awake all day at work.  

Peets meets both requirements with flying colors.  They open early, but they are hardly ever crowded around 7 so I can get my coffee & scone without a line.  And, their coffee makes me twitch.  I get headaches when I try and drink most other coffee now.  

One thing--I've gone to this Peets almost every Monday-Friday for the past 8 months now and I order the exact same thing every morning, but they still have to ask.  Aren't I a regular yet?
author: Katie S.

description:
This is hands-down best Peet's in the universe. 

I haven't been to every Peet's in the universe, but I've definitely been to more than my fair share all over the bay area, in NY (JFK) and Massachusetts. The Sacramento / California Peet's is by far the best. 

Why? 

1. Fast service - walk in on any morning and your heart sinks looking at the 10+ person line... you think, "do I really have time for this before dashing off to work?"... but you know you NEED the caffeine, so you settle into the end of the line. Within 3 minutes, you're the next person up. It really moves that smoothly and swiftly.
 
2. Friendly staff - fun, courteous, professional, seem to really enjoy their jobs

3. Very fresh coffee

The staff is so well managed here - you can tell because people seem genuinely happy about being at work (okay, nobody is hopping in the air clicking their heels together, but you get it - nobody looks miserable) and the service is just phenomenally professional and swift.
author: Hannah Q.

description:
The Fillmore Peet's is like cheating--fun, exciting, and wrong.  But when Bittersweet isn't putting out, I have no choice.  

Bittersweet is my first choice for coffee on Fillmore because it brews Blue Bottle and has a kickass staff.  HOWEVER, those damn bastards don't open until 10am and sometimes I can't wait that long for my morning fix.  (note: "damn bastards" is a term of endearment).

Enter: Peet's.  The coffee is great and so is the staff here.  The pastries are doable--and again, so is the staff.  (Kidding!  Do-ability does not enter into the equation...I can't imagine doing ANYTHING until I've coffeed-up). 

My only reservation is the placement of the half&half/sugar station at the end of the bar.  It gets cramped with people at their crankiest--that is, me and my coffee-hooked brethren just prior to our first hit of the day.  Despite this, I still love Peet's--my coffee action on the side.

Just don't tell Bittersweet.
author: Eric E.

description:
Might not be the most reliable review since I only went here for the first time today but here goes!

Place was nice, pretty large compared to my usual Peet's at West Portal, but the people weren't as friendly. C'mon, get in the holiday spirit! My friend's pumpkin spice latte contained a bit more latte than pumpkin spice & my peppermint mocha was pretty good. As much as I hate to say this, Starbucks is a bit better at the sweet drinks although I will forever worship Peet's coffee!
author: Steph W.

description:
As a fomer employee of this Peet's, am I allowed to rate it? 
I'm going to, 
I worked at the Pacific Heights Peet's for 2 years. And I loved it. Prior to working at the this Peet's, I worked at the Peet's in Walnut Creek. While vastly differerent, I loved both. 
The Head honcho here though, Brian Chew, WOW...I can not compliment him enough. He has the CUTEST, NICEST little kids that his cute wife brings in a few times a week. The staff know and love all of them. He himself is one of the nicest person's I have ever known. And he really creates a family-like atmosphere in the store with both the employees and the customers. 
The coffee there is THE best. Always fresh people, always fresh. 
The pastries are delievered every morning and not kept the next day. 
The specialty drinks are made by employees that have been working there and making the same drinks for years. 

I really can not say enough good stuff about this place.
author: Joanna R.

description:
Peet's beats! ....any coffee shop like Starbucks or  Beans & Co. :)

I must say the quality of  coffee is super duper quadruple better than Starbucks or any of  those chain joints. 

Coffee: Very rich in flavor, has the caffeine to keep you going, and if you order a more sweet drink it doesn't feel like you're drinking a cup of liquefied sugar. It defeats the purpose of coffee if you are bombarded by sugar, Starbucks ;)  you can actually taste the coffee (which I love as a coffee addict).  I usually order the house coffee, with a splash of hazelnut, or my usual soy hazelnut (1 pump of it) latte. The drinks never fail. The teas are always superb too. I like the green tea, just be aware because if you're impatient like me, it'll scorch the crap out of your mouth if you don't wait for it to cool down.  

Service: Always so welcoming and nice! The employees (even the customers) are pleasant, and prompt with the service. On weekend mornings I love walking in and seeing all the customers and  their dogs. :) 

I've gone here for YEARS, and will continue to visit!
author: Catherine O.

description: So, I've never been to this location, but I've been a fan of Peet's since the Opera Plaza location opened several years ago. I just  found out today that one of the long-time baristas there, Jen, is no longer working at the OP location.  I was told by one of the other girls, Jana, that Jen's last day was last Thursday. Asked her which location Jen was working at now and she said the Fillmore location, so I'm assuming it's this one. In any case, just want to say you're lucky to have her. She's a great worker and always smiling and cheery. She has great customer service skills and has always made my drink right on!. I'm sad now. Time to go drown my sorrows in my sugar-free mocha w/soy  =(.
author: Neni E.

description: There are few places in the city to grab a solid coffee quickly.  These guys kill it.
author: craig b.

description:
This is my favorite Peet's.
I miss Brian, (the old manager), but it still has the location and the ambiance. I am a little biased, as the place has sentimental history for me. The customers matter just as much as the staff, and this place wins on that. Good people watching.
author: Vale C.

description:
This place will offer you an amazing cup of coffee. Everyday. The coffee is consistently fantastic and the staff is very friendly and fast....unlike other coffee shops across the street (ahem, coffee bean). 

This neighborhood institution is a cute hangout. Watch out for the man with the pit bull who on occasion might threaten your dog.
author: lindsey l.

description:
The best coffee in the universe.
Surely, as Zrogloiy wears weary flying from Orion to Polaris, he'll/she'll (like frogs, Inklidorians like Zrogloiy are simultaneously both sexes) stop by this dumptser hut of a planet and politely buy a large cup of the intergalactic fav.
Major Dickason is in fact retired from the Inklidorian Air Force.
In short, out of this world.
author: Theo R.

description:
May 2008
Tried cappucinos three times since Brian left and the brew is never consistently PEET-y. Such a disappointment. Once there was some skinny, meth looking barrista that just couldn't get the rhthym and flavor right with the espresso and steamed milk and I watched the other three people by the sugar and stir sticks with their wrinkled nose expressions on their face...later saw one even dump the cap,  into the garbage bin on Fillmore street...right in front of Peet's...guess he really thought it sucked. 

Well, I still get my beans here once a year...yes, moving towards Blue Bottle beans...

*********
August 2007

Thanks Brian Ip Chew, 
former (1999-2007?) Store Manager of Peet's Coffee @2197 Fillmore!!!!!!!!!!

You have always hired and trained your staff really well to make great cappucinos and okay service...by that I mean that I have NEVER had a server that was a NIHILIST Landmark Theatre Punksterwhodoesn't giveashaitboutanythingbutlivingintheirshaittyworld type of delivery.

Thanks for the eight year run on FIllmore.

I guess Josel Nelson is a standby employee reaching his 10 year mark in December and the new manager, Jonathan Gray...(hey wonder if he read that Women are from Venus, Men from Mars book?!)

Thanks Brian, and best wishes for wonderful things in your next adventure!!!!!!! The neighborhood will miss you.
*******
Waaahhhh....Yelp is sooo overwhelmed it won't let me add a NEW Peet's hidden out in NOPAlandia

Check it out if you need a good one before heading out...Just opened Nov. 3, 2006...probably going to start opening later Mon-Fri from 6 AM can't believe the 5:30 start...but hey, java-cat..you go grrrrllll.

310 Broderick St.
San Francisco, CA  94117
(415) 593-8830

Approximate Distance: 1.1 Miles
View Map | Driving Directions Mon-Fri:5:30am-8pm
Sat-Sun:6am-8pm 

http://www.peets.com/stores/store_locator.asp

**
Only for iron stomachs that can take the strongest brew to be found on Fillmoe, filled with lecherous gut bellied men on the weekdays mid day  that are waiting for Catholic teenage girls to walk by.  Just get it to go and window shop till you finish that java, or walk up to Broadway for a view of why you decided to live here. You don't live to work cuz they are gonna outsource your job to Inja before ya save enuff fo yo retirement, dude.
author: miriam b.

description: Good reliable strong coffee....alot stronger that SBucks freakin pike coffee...that stuff is just weak!!!  Hung out here while waiting for wife to finish her massage and its a great spot to just ppl watch and have a great cup of coffee...the staff here are efficient and knowledgeable.  I get my coffee here every time i'm in the filmore district.
author: Jeremy K.

description: It was a fabulous place to be once upon a time. I know the bathroom is not tidy, and all those complaints Yelpers complain about are true to the heart, however my coffee has always been up to par. Also once I realized I was getting a double espresso, and I didn't want a double, a girl verified that they do give doubles and then I simply requested a single and it was fine.
author: Lisa L.

description:
it's Peet's. I don't drink coffee, but I tasted some. I guess it was good. The small is $3.20. I'm assuming that's the going rate, but IMHO, that seems a little expensive. 

Anyway, It was a nice walk up to the shop and we got there at 8:55PM and they were ready and willing to serve us. Anyway, thumbs up for the service as well.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Such a cute neighborhood scene, with young families and elderly people reading the paper, and friendly greetings between neighbors, that it kind of makes me sick. Why are rich white people so...idyllic?

Good coffee, though. And this is a pretty efficient coffee shop considering the high volume of orders. I usually get my drink within a minute. And they have Splenda.
author: Megan W.

description:
I can't believe I'm reviewing a Peets coffee shop, but I have to say that this one is a little bit different ... I've been an occasional visitor for the last 8 years, but when I recently moved 2 blocks away and decided to give away my coffee maker, I gained a whole new appreciation for the place. 

The people who work there are sweet, patient. always smiling, AND they know their customers. Every morning they start off my day the right way, even that rainy morning when I spilled coffee all over everything! This is on my list of top twenty things I love about San Francisco ....
author: Rachel A.

description: A good place to perch and check out the locals, and there is usually  a steady parade of highly structured coiffure displayed on humans and canines both. Just be careful not to laugh so hard that the coffee goes up your nose.
author: Stellah D.

description:
1. I dont understand what takes so long. 
2. Why is my americano lukewarm?
3. Why are the above 2 always true? 

Gets the big EH out of me.
author: ruth k.

description:
having a friend move into the neighborhood brought me here.  
Latte: as good as Peet's goes.  food: i had my 2nd default- the chocolate-covered/taffy something almond. 
setting: few bar tables [~3-4], a long narrow bar/counter facing the streets along the two external walls - Sacramento X Fillmore, few more  [~3-4] small round tables. 
clean bathroom @ the far back end. 
service: OK. 
Observations/Experience: we passed the place on our way to-from lunch.  crowded to the max. looking in, EVERYONE was looking at a computer;s monitor. If personal space is important to you, this is not the place for you. 
when i came in to work, had to wait for a seating, then moved once to improve my location.  the 1-hour free wi-fi voucher does not get people to leave, as quite a few have the Verizon/AT&T dangles. for a while i was sitting next to a female with 2 blackberries, one laptop and a cappuccino she barely touched.  NOT a place to making new friends.  
fits its purpose.  
BIGGEST PROBLEM: not enough electrical outlets to accommodate all devices. should have them along the counters.
will i be back? likely.
author: yael w.

description:
I like Peet's coffee. It's strong and they have lots of milk choices.

This Peet's loses a point because it's ridiculously crowded weekday mornings, which is when I want Peet's most.
author: kiki d.

description: Love the Xiao's blend tea, which is a mix of peppermint, rose hips, and chamomile..breathing the steam just helped my throat!
author: Emm C.

description:
I'm lovin' the cream-cheese frosted ginger bread cake lately. yum-yum.

Thank god they don't do it year-round.

Other than that, this place is a scene. Who are these people that sit outside EVERY morning with their dogs? I'm jealous!
author: jodes l.

description:
This makes Peet's stop #3...

The Fillmore Peet's is pretty small and overall pretty unremarkable.  I didn't get a "neighborhood paper-readers" vibe so much as a "busy shoppers resting their feet" vibe.  Actually I was one of those busy shoppers, and it being a sunny afternoon, I was looking for something cool and refreshing, so I tried the jasmine lime tea cooler.  I'm always wary of drinks like this, lest they turn out to be glorified sugar-water, but it did in fact taste like a thoughtful combination of lime and fragrant tea.  Interesting but not for everyone.
author: Wes M.

description:
I have to say, Peet's quality of coffee is definitely waaaayy better than Starbuck's.  Though occassionally I still make a Starbucks stop, only because it is convenient for it is scattered on every corner and is open later. 

I stopped by this Peet's after a workout at my gym around the corner on California, knowing that I had to drive an hour and half to Sacramento, and needed a caffeine boost.  I went in (it was quite quiet for a Friday), the nice man took my order, and the very friendly barista took her time to make me my hot, delicious nonfat, hazelnut latte.  I wanted to hang out there a little longer because a nice gentleman was sitting at the table next to me, waiting for his order, but I was on a time crunch.  

I felt a little ashamed for bringing in my Starbucks coffee mug to be filled with Peet's Coffee.  Tsk tsk on me....
author: Lisa C.

description: I enjoyed the yummy hot chocolate this morning at Peet's on Fillmoore Street!
author: Jerod Y.

description:
Peet's is a paradox to me. It's a chain coffeehouse, yet somehow manages to seem so genuine, so local, and so quality. Would take a cup of bold Peet's joe over most anything from Starbucks - and their pastries (not to mention chocolate-covered cherries) blow the Bux out of the water. A truly heartwarming place. 

What pleases me most about this particular Peet's is that it makes for the perfect lazy, sunny Sunday: grab a paper, stroll down to the Fillmore Peet's and join the friendly neighbors at a seat along the lengthy bar next to the window, soak in the aromas of fresh coffee and sip my latte. Maybe stop by Browser Books on the way out, pet a few overzealous dogs, hit up Alta Plaza Park and take a nap on the grass. All while breathing in a cool Pacific breeze. Ah me, San Francisco is the greatest.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Like Neo, if you don't make the right choice, you'll never know the truth.  

Best coffee in the Bay area.  The Fillmore Peet's has fantastic staff and the manager Bryan runs a great shop. Drip is strong, you can taste the coffee in your latte and they have a great selection of Tea. 
 
Give it a try and by your second time you'll be hooked.  

Drink local, think global!!!

 
 G
author: Piper C.

description:
Tremendous! I work two doors down from Peets, go in for my "small" coffee every morning and am constantly amazed by how cool and generous and friendly the staff are, even when it's so busy that the U-shaped queue threatens to snake out the front door. I say "small" because my coffee actually ends up being a medium, "own cup" user and all that I am. 

Great variety of drip coffees, too. At least once a week i walk out of there, take a sip and think, "could this cup be any more PERFECT?". The rest of the week it's strong and yummy, of course.

Brian the manager is the friendliest you'll ever meet, and always has time to chat even while he's at the coffee station grinding and pouring and measuring and trying to getting complex coffee configurations right for all the high-stress Bens and Jens anxiously awaiting their fix.

Some very sharp looking people in here on a weekday morning, too. The well-dressed, successful men I find intimidating, but I just turn a blind eye and instead feast my gaze on the pretty exec ladies in expensive, well-tailored outfits. Mmm.
author: Juan C.

description:
i went to peet's tonight due to a sweet tooth craving and more importantly because my stomach was growling.  i asked for a slice of banana bread, but the lady behind the counter gave me to slices for the price of one! SCORE!  the banana bread was nice and thick, banana-ey, but not overly oily and greasy like most banana breads nowadays.  

awesome-ness.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I say "Fill me more"!

A great location for reading and people watching on a Saturday or Sunday. Easier to find parking on a Sunday though.

If you want to build a coffee-table book (what else would it be when you are at a cafe!) of faces and styles from SF, sit on the side-street with a camera and shoot at sight. You will not be disappointed.

And hey, next time you see a guy sitting outside with a book, and occasionally lifting up his head to get a glimpse of some great legs, please say "Hi"!
author: Guru T.

description:
Peet's...

I love you.
I need you.

The Fillmore Peet's is my favorite Peet's by far.  Luckily, it's right around the corner from me!  LOVE my soy Americano, especially if the nice man with the ponytail makes it.  Perfect foam, every time.  Everyone is friendly, people bring/buy their own newspapers and leave them behind for other customers, and the line always moves quickly.  Good people watching, too.  Not sure what I'd do without this place providing my daily cuppa joe.

Also, props on somehow shooing the birds away.  Used to be a bit of a problem, especially on weekends.
author: Marina Maven C.

description:
I would have given Peet's 5 stars even a few months ago. When I moved up here from LA, I discovered the wonderful coffee that is contained within the four walls of Peet's.

But I have since discovered Blue Bottle Coffee. This is no reflection on Peet's; I visit them daily on my way to work, and you should too. But you should go to Blue Bottle and understand the true power of amazing coffee.
author: Carol S.

description:
People that write reviews for chain restaurants / establishments are idiots. I am also an Idiot. 

I order a large coffee and they don't fuck it up. What more can I ask for.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
My lovely younger sister gave me a $25 gift card to Peet's, and I figured, it's a beautiful day out... why not mozy on down to Pacific Heights for an iced coffee?
The only time I'd ever had Peet's coffee before was at one of their kiosks in SFO and I was never very impressed with their coffee or their chai lattes. Today, however, was a different day and a different Peet's!
Right now I have a killer sore throat and wanted something icy and smooth. I opted for the caramel freddo sans whipped cream. Whoo-wee! I slurped the whole thing up in record time and didn't even get a brain freeze! All the dairy wasn't very good for my achy throat so I figured I should wash it down with some green tea. The guy at the counter was very helpful in helping my make my selection of which green tea I wanted (They had soooo many teas!!!) and instead of the tea being pre-bagged they put the loose leaves in a bag right in front of my eyes! Now THAT'S quality!
Too bad I missed my bus while they were bagging the tea. Oh, well. As I said, today was a beautiful day and it probably did me some good to get a little sun on my pale San Franciscan skin.
author: Felicity M.

description: Thank you so much for providing wifi to your customers. The Grove down the street sucks because they make you purchase $5 worth of food/drink for just 1/2 hour of wifi use. I got a whole hour there and there isn't a ridiculous minimum purchase. I've been writing a lot lately and I am so thankful to have a place in the neighborhood where I can get a good cup of joe and some work done at the same time. Way to go!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Great customer experience!!!!!!  Staff is very nice, helpful, friendly and appreciates the customer.

Keep up the great work!!!
author: skipper a.

description: I miss this location. They're still around, but I moved away. The coffee was always good and the staff was always cool. My morning routine, and when the sun was out, stop and sit on a bench on the south facing slope of Fillmore.
author: ryan c.

description: Friendly quick service, the usual array of fine vegan cookies, good soy latte.  One star removed for all hard seating.  Often crowded, nice place to hang out while waiting for movies at Kabuki or New People's Cinema on Post St.
author: Bob G.

description: This is the Peet's for people watching.  Peet's is greater than Coffee Bean is greater than Starbucks. Starbucks is serving water as far as I'm concerned. All that's missing at this Fillmore intersection is a fourth coffee place.
author: Maggie L.

description: I'm a Starbucks guy.  Not really by choice but the closest coffee to my work is a Starbucks (not counting Battery Street Coffee Roastery which makes some of the worst coffee I've ever had)  Last week I started an editing project in Pac Heights and stopped in to this Peet's a couple of times for my soy latte fix.  On both days the place was packed but the employees kept the coffee flowing and had me in and out in no time.  Good stuff, I'll be back.
author: phil h.

description: Is it just me or are Peet's employees on average a lot more chill and friendly than Starbucks employees? (No offense to you friendly Starbucks people- I like you, I do, but maybe tell your colleagues to perk up a bit eh?) Also, I think Peet's coffee is better quality, and they offered me 2 choices of soy milk flavors. I'm sold. Yay Peets.
author: Megan G.

description:
this is a very chill place to hang out on a weekend morning. good strong coffee + lots of people watching = one relaxed jeremy. 

look for me. i'll more than likely be wearing a baseball cap, pretending to study, and will probably wink at ya as you walk by.
author: Jeremy D.

description: Coffee's good, but what's up with being out of oatmeal twice, once in the afternoon, and once early in the morning?  If you can't get, pls don't advertise.
author: Sabine W.

description:
When I'm dragging around, I know Peet's will cure me.  This place is phenomenal.  Wonderfully potent coffee and a staff that is not only kind but also quick.  In no time, any worker there can whip up a tasty drink that will knock you over.  
Peet's can also be a magnet for people who love "displaying" their ideologies, and an Anti-Bush sign usually populates the outside.  We all know, buddy... he sucks, now take your sign down: if that's how you make a difference, then rebellion and dissidence is dead.  "Revolutionaries" in this country are soft and milk fed.  Like the steaming frothy milk in that yummy Latte being consumed on "Freedom Corner."  
Peet's should also come with a dog check, because I have trouble getting around all the pooches and their doting owners who only know the names of other dogs, not the dog owners themselves... ah, the lonesome, crowded west.  
So- the coffee is great, I feel lucky to have one in my neighborhood.  The only drawbacks are the armchair revolutionaries who feel like they're making a difference by posting signs about the obvious.  Hey, "Che": I'm scared to see how many bumper stickers you have on the back of your 1985 Volvo.  Now, that's making a change!

PS- great coffee
author: Sam L.

description: I generally like Peet's more for their beans, but I'm happy to stop in just for a cup, too.  Peet's is definitely not for everyone.  If you like your coffee super strong and acidic, you'll love Peet's.  If you don't... well, go somewhere else.
author: Andrew E.

description: Extremely awkward set up and always crowded but the best coffee on Fillmore Street. Their mocha has made many an afternoon at my job tolerable.
author: Maria D.

description:
I am a Peet's fan, no doubt. But this place had the worst mocha I ever had. Come here often on the weekends always after the morning jog. It's always packed with neighborhood crowd. To be honest, the place is way too compact to accommodate all the people that they try to jam in here. I have already encountered 2 incidences of getting barely warm mocha. I guess that was the end-result of joggle through so many orders at once. 
I should have asked for "extra-hot, but then again, they might forget just as I told them to have it flat, yet they still put whip cream with foam in there.
author: S Y.

description:
Peet's is definitely my favorite mainstream coffee shop (Starbucks, Tully's etc. are just so gross!!). The coffee here is strong- just how I like it, and even their flavored drinks, like the awesome holiday beverages, are delicious. The baristas at this location are always super nice and I've never really had a bad experience here. And, oh-my-god the vegan ginger cookies are AMAZING; it's always sad when I walk in expecting to have my regular small soy cappucino and vegan ginger cookie and find that the cookies are sold out!

Really friendly baristas, and great tasting coffee- you can't go wrong with that.
author: Jogreet C.

description: I love Peets. The Gaia Organic Blend is my favorite. The first thing I do when I get in the city is hit Peets!
author: Laura F.

description: This is pretty good for corporate coffee.  And who doesn't love to people watch? Business meetings between men with ugly ties and women with poofy hairdoos.  The random hippie chick who orders her soy chai and stops to pet the fluffy white dog dressed in a sweater vest out front.  Its that old lady's dog.  The one that has been in the bathroom for almost 20 minutes causing a line to form, because there is only one bathroom and dammit, coffee drinkers have to pee! Bars and cafe's, the two most pee provoking places you would think would have multiple bathrooms but that is almost never the case. I'm not sure where this review is going now, so I will just leave it at that.
author: Starla D.

description: My local Peet's rocks!  Always so nice, efficient, and gracious.  Service is quick and great for the morning rush.  Customers are chill for the 'hood.  I like sitting outside and watching the world go by, and the doggies.  It's like the local Cheers except with no booze...  But, ppl do know your name here...  Peet's trumps Coffee Bean and Starbucks.  Potential competitor is the Boulangerie, soy chai latte.
author: Mayah C.

description: Often feels like a newspaper truck exploded in here.  However, it has more generous seating than several other Peet's.  Feels a little out of the Fillmore strip action, though.  I usually hit the Grove instead, unless it's wall to wall laptop monkeys.
author: Kevin S.

description: As the main competitor to my beloved Coffee Bean across the street, I have to say I'm just not a fan. Honestly it is a bit too crowded all the time and their hot chocolate is not good (I'm not a coffee drinker, but am however a hot chocolate connoisseur). Best thing here are the bread's & muffins.
author: Stephanie W.

description: This place has the cutest lounge area of all the Peet's I've been too.  The plus side with this one is that you can sit inside or out and sip your green tea smoothie or coffee!
author: Alan T.

description: A great coffee shop to stop in while shopping along Fillmore. (You can also find them almost anywhere else in the city as well) Try the the dark chocolate freddo!
author: Carly W.

description: I don't get it.   I like coffee.  I'm from Seattle and realize Starbucks is crap.  How is it that Pete's is worse?  Every time I go there, I get combinations of sour and bitter so that I can't even swallow the murk down.
author: Maria C.

description: Used to be a great hangout until they let it turn into a psych ward. Still the best and strongest coffee around, and great for people-watching!
author: Tanya L.

description: Location has steady flow of traffic but not overwhelmingly so. The employees know this.
author: Eugene G.

description: Mmmm...Peet's! "Grow hair on your chest" coffee. Can't beat that.
author: Fern D.

description: Best Peet's location in the city, and the best outdoor hang-out spot on Fillmore. The drinks are good, and the crowds are less snobby than in "brunch alley" down the street. A great place to chat people up and the best weekend morning spot.
author: Chris B.

description: Peet's is the best! I usually go to Peets on Market Street, near Castro, sometimes on Fillmore. I can't wait to have Peet's near my work (Union Square). I love strong and tasty coffee. There is nothing like Peet's!
author: Frances G.

description: For being there each and every morning. For their delightful staff including Bruce, Cressida and Brian. For having the widest selection of teas outside of Chinatown. For being a place to see neighborhood friends and catch-up. For dealing with my barking dogs waiting outside the door. Gen mai cha.
author: carina b.

description: This Peets has it all. Great staff, free Internet, fantastic beverages and a perfect location. Stuck on the corner of Fillmore and Sacramento it is the ideal spot to read a book, catch up on email or just people watch.
author: Cat K.

description: good pete's in the heart of my hood. i used to hate pete's sooo effin bad - i just thought it was too bitter. it's grown on me over the years. still not as good as the coffee as noah's (my favorite) but waaay better than starbucks. (then why do i spend half my waking hours at starbucks, you ask? damn good question.)
author: Janet G.

description: there is not a ton of seating if you want to stay, but i always manage to find a spot to sit and drink coffee and read. this is a good peet's!
author: Ellie R.

description: Probably the best chain coffee company that also happens to be local.
author: herb w.

description: This place converted me from Starbucks.  Tastes great and super nice people work here.  LOVE IT
author: Christin A.

description: Peets is my mainstream brand of choice, when I'm not close to a Martha's Bros.  Sadly, this Peets has gone downhill after they remodeled. Now it's big and impersonal and not the clean well-lighted place of the past. The old staff appears to have disappeared.  The servers now are alternatingly diffident or surly, one passively aggressively topping my coffee off with the wrong milk just to make a point.  I fear this is Peet's future, but Starbucks taste-wise isn't a real alternative.
author: Paul B.

description:
i used to work in coffee for three years. i know the drill... ten minutes before close: dump the brewed coffee, clean up the tables and espresso machine, sweep, and basically close up shop before you lock the doors. it probably wasn't the best idea to do... but the majority of the time no one walked in that door at 7:50pm to order a triple espresso... so cleaning the machine was always a good bet. 
well i did the same thing, much to my chagrin. i asked the guy for a triple americano, but wanted to make sure that he hadn't already cleaned the machine... even though i could very well see that he had. but with a big smile on his face, he said "of course i'll make you your drink." i usually gave people attitude when they ordered these drinks at the cusp of closing... but he was nothing but smiles and great customer service. he proceeded to pour out some shots that he had poured.. and explained to me that they had poured too fast and didn't want to serve them to me. i know the difference between fast shots and shots that have been brewing for 25 seconds, so it was greatly appreciated. he served me my drink and i left with a smile. 
awesome service, awesome coffee, and a great location. 
i love peets.
author: Erin D.

description: one has a lot of choices for coffee on fillmore.  there's an argument for each establishment.  peet's is great in the all-around category.  their drinks aren't as sugary sweet as the coffee bean, their selection is better than royal ground, and, well, it's not starbucks.  the atmosphere isn't as cozy or expansive at the grove, but it's about twice the size of coffee bean's.  one can usually pick up a wireless connection, too.  and you've got browser books next door, which is a great combo.
author: Amy W.

description: Love my local Peets!  Yes, sometimes there can be a line.  But if Farron or Mellete are working the machine, you'll be getting your caffine geek on pronto!
author: connor o.
